sub_title: Senior project manager/ data analyst/ consultant/researcher- transport and mobility unit at Panteia
summary:
Graduated with a Master in Spatial Planning Engineering from the IST-Technical University of Lisbon. Working in the field of transport and mobility since 2006, gaining considerable experience in the management of National, European and International projects. 
Expert in EU transport policy, planning, and economics, TEN-T policy, TEN-T network and corridors, including in-depth knowledge of TEN-T Regulation 1315/2013, urban mobility (passenger and urban logistics), multimodal transport and transport infrastructure, freight transport&logistics. 
Have been working mainly for EU institutions such European Commission, European Parliament, ESA, Committee of the Regions, etc in projects covering EU Member States and also Brazil, Peru, Algeria, and Morocco. At the international level, have also worked for the African Development Bank and World Bank. 
Senior project manager with experience in project management and coordination of international consortia and projects. Besides project management skills, experience in data collection, data and market analysis, EU policy analysis,evaluation&impact assessment (BRG) benchmarking, business models development, stakeholders engagement and consultation, events organisation, training and capacity building. 
Responsible for the development of the company’s segment plan for EU Transport where the company strategy for the European market on the transport segment is defined, as well as the opportunities and targets. Internal coordinator of the TEN-T corridor studies where Panteia is a partner/coordinator: Atlantic, Mediterranean, North Sea-Mediterranean, Rhine Alpine, North Sea Baltic, Rhine Danube, Orient East Mediterranean.

Recent key project references:

European Parliament:
-Future of transport in the Recovery Plan
-Relaunching transport&tourism in EU after COVID-19
-Sustainable and smart urban transport,inc. impacts of COVID-19
 
European Commission:
- i4Driving (Horizon Europe CCAM)
- Ambassadors for Diversity in transport
- Evaluation and IA of the Weights &dimensions Directive
-Urban and regional vehicle access regulation schemes-UVARExchange (cross border data sharing,C-ITS,VMS)
-Impact assess. on driving times and rest periods
-New mobility patterns for EU cities
-TEN-T corridor studies
-Assessment of Member States national plans and their alignment with TEN-T Regulation(article 49.2)
-Mapping accessible transport for persons with reduced mobility
-Impact assess. of Streamlining TEN-T
-Review of plans and programmes for TEN-T progress report(article 49.3)
-NOVELOG-New cooperative business models for urban logistics

profile_positions.description: External evaluator for transport calls of Horizon Europe, including cities mission and CEF transport.
profile_positions.title: External exper for CINEA

profile_positions.description: Responsible for proposal evaluations in the area of transportation, clean fuels, transport networks for the SME Instrument.
profile_positions.title: External expert for the SME instrument

profile_positions.description:
Currently works for the Department of Economy and Management as a consultant and researcher in Transport Economics.
More than 8 years of experience in national and international consultancy and research in the Transport topics with a major focus in cost/benefit estimation and urban logistics related issues; national and international proposal preparation and project management (most as coordinator or key partner) of teams with different nationalities in the technical, financial and management components. Most of these proposals and projects have been developed for European Commission Programmes such as: FP6, FP7, Intelligent Energy for Europe (IEE); Inter-American Development Bank (IDB); World Bank; as well as consultancy studies for national and local authorities.


Atualmente a trabalhar no Núcleo de Economia e Gestão com as funções de consultoria e investigação na área da Economia dos Transportes.
Mais de 8 anos de experiência em consultoria e investigação nacional e internacional na área dos Transportes com enfoque na estimação de custos e beneficios e logística urbana; preparação de propostas nacionais e internacionais e gestão de projetos (maioria em liderança ou como parceiro príncipal) com equipas de grande dimensão e de diferentes nacionalidades nas vertentes técnicas, financeira e de gestão. 
A maioria destas propostas e projetos foram desenvolvidas para Programas lançados pela Comissão Europeia como o PQ 6, PQ 7, IEE; Banco Interamericano de Desenvolvimento (BID); Banco Mundial; bem como estudos de consultoria para autoridades locais e nacionais.
profile_positions.title: Transport policy Consultant (Engineer)
